titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” I-1) Introduction (fols. 5ra-8ra) I-1) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 8ra-11ra) I-2) Palm Sunday (fols. 11ra-19va) I-3) Monday (fols. 19vb-41vb) I-4) Tuesday (fols. 41vb-63vb) I-5) Wednesday (fols. 63vb-80vb) I-6) Thursday (fols. 80vb-108rb) I-7) Friday (fols. 108rb-183rb) I-8) Saturday (fols. 183r-216v) - Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 186r-201v) - Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 212va-214rb) I-9) Directives for the rite of the Passion Week (Good Friday) (fols. 217ra)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: The hand is quite similar, though probably not identical, to that of the Vita of ʾƎsṭifanos of Gundä Gunde (Mordini 146, s. EAE II, 390) and a Four Gospels book from Gundä Gunde, Walters Museum W.850 (dated to 1500-50).

donors.donor: The donor was possibly Bä-Ḫaylä ʾIyäsus mentioned in Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The original sewing is missing; the Ms. was resewn with modern synthetic threads. Cuts amended on fols. 1, 2, 64, 94, 116, 172, 179, 183, 184, 202, 210. A strip of parchment is carefully sewn in the margin of fols. 79, 89.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Rows of small holes, two close to the head, two close to the tail are visible on the spine folds of the quires.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The scribe disregarded the ruling, e.g., on fols. 66r, 113rb, 114vb, 185r.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting doesn´t remains the same throughout the Ms.: e.g., fols. 28vb, 83va, 120r-121r (more broadly spaced letters), fols. 103vb (thicker letters), 112v-113v (compressed script). Some distinctive features of the handwriting are: - the left vertical stroke of ሰ is often slightly waving (particularly visible in the sixth order: e.g., fols. 5rb l.22, 12rb l.2, 14ra ls.7-8); the same phenomenon occurs rarely to በ: e.g., fols. 31vb ls.2-7, 61ra l.1, (s. THMR-002) - ቱ sometimes has the vowel marker attached to the upper part of the vertical stroke: e.g., fols. 6rb l.7, 24rb l.18, 183ra l.23 (s.THMR-002). Coronis are used as a text divider in fols. 7r (between chains of black and red dots), 66vb (along with chains of dashes and dots), 185vb (along with dashes and dots). The hand is particularly similar to the one attested in the Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat THMR-002 (s. EAE II, 727) and in the Senodos of Gundä Gunde (s. EAE IV, 624).

pcruxansatas.pcruxansata: Crux ansata is used as a text divider in fols. 41ra, 164ra (?).

rubrications.rubrication: Headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections (in some cases a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines, fols. 5r, 7v, 8r, 18va, 19vb, 23r, 28ra, 29rb, 35va, 45r, 67r, 84r, 118vb, 122r, 144ra, 152ra, 185vb, 186r, 202ra, 217r); titles of the Biblical books and other works; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals; names of Hebrew letters on fols. 172rb-173ra (Lam. 3); directives for the ministers; elements of text dividers.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The ornamental bands are very skilfully executed, esp. fols. 5r, 7v, 8r, 23r, 45r, 67r, 84r, 122r, 162r, 186r.

additional.cont: Fol. 66va: Exhortation to the priests to commemorate (the commissioner or donor?) Bä-Ḫaylä ˀIyäsus.
additional.tran: Fol. 66va: Remember Bä-Ḫaylä ˀIyäsus in the time of the incense burning and the offering. His mother is ˀAlaṗis and the father of his mother is Täwäldä Mädḫən. He took a half of its price and another half he left for the church, for the sake of Ṗaraqliṭos, our God.
additional.det: Written in a more recent hand than that of the main text, possibly early 17th cent. (?).

additional.cont: Fol. 217r: Record concerning a reconciliation.
additional.tran: Fol. 217r: Those who reconciled are five elders, blatta Ḫaylu and blatta Məraḉ, blattaTäklä Maryam, šəqa ˀAymut, ˀato Śahlu…
additional.det: Written in Amharic, in an early 17th-cent. hand(?), same as Additio 1. Separated by a simple ornamental divider band.

extras.extra: - Erasures: e.g., fols. 12ra l. 27, 12va l. 3, l.9, 69vb l.14, 113rb l.30 (marked by two lines above), 26va ls. 14-17, 31va ls. 16-17, 51va l.21, 52va l.25, 59v l.17, 90rb ls.27-28. - Corrections written over erasures (possible written by the same hand as that of Additiones 1 and 2): e.g., fols. 8va l.33, 12vb, l.22, 24va l.1, 59v ls.18-19, 64rb ls.4-5, 93ra ls.24-25. - Omitted passages or excerpts from the Gospels (?) added, possible by the same hand as that of Addiones 1,2, in the upper margins: e.g., fols. 131v-133r, 141v-142v. - Small numbers are added in the margins of columns on fols. 52va-54rb, - Drawing excercises: fols. 1v-2r.

frames.frame: - Fols. 5r, 7v, 8r, 23r, 45r, 67r, 84r, 122r, 162r, 186r: elaborate coloured ornamental band extending up to the upper edge of the page, with two lateral and one central extensions reaching the bottom of the text; interlaced, geometric and floral motifs. - Fols. 18va, 19vb, 21rb, 22ra (not coloured), 35va, 36rb, 42vb, 43va, 44rb, 49vb, 52va, 60vb, 72rb, 73ra, 74va, 86va, 87vb, 90ra, 108rb, 133vb, 134vb, 144ra, 152 ra, 168va, 172rb, 185vb, 202ra: elaborate coloured ornamental bands; interlaced, geometric and floral motifs.
